Legal_Issue: Breach of natural justice due to poor interpretation
Evidence_Assessment: Alleged misinterpretations were minor and did not affect fairness
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate breach of natural justice
Credibility_Factor: Interpreter's competence and accuracy questioned by applicant
Legal_Rule: Interpretation must be continuous, precise, competent, impartial, and contemporaneous
Procedural_Issue: Quality of interpretation during appeal hearing
Grounds_for_Claim: Poor interpretation prevented effective presentation of case
Outcome_on_Merits: No breach of natural justice found
Review_Standard: Whether IAD's refusal to reopen was justified
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Proceedings were fair despite alleged errors
Key_Evidence_Considered: Nature and impact of alleged interpretation errors
Applicant_Challenge: Inadequate interpretation during IAD appeal hearing
Legal_Rule_Source: IRPA Section 71 and relevant case law
Defendant_Response: Interpretation met required standards; no material error
Remedy_Requested: Reopening of appeal due to procedural unfairness
Decision_Authority: Immigration Appeal Division (IAD), reviewed by Federal Court
Remedy_Sought: Judicial review allowing reopening of appeal
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review under federal court jurisdiction
Applicable_Process: Appeal before IAD followed by judicial review
Governing_Rule: Principles of natural justice in administrative proceedings
